Questions.Text: What is a Minimum Viable Product (MVP), and why is it important in a phased rollout strategy?
Options: A) A fully-featured product that is released to the entire market.
B) The initial version of a product with just enough features to satisfy early adopters.
C) A product that has all the features but is not yet tested.
D) A prototype that is never released to the market.

Questions.Text: Which of the following is NOT a key component of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)?
What does 'scalability' mean in the context of an e-commerce platform?
Options: A) The ability to reduce the size of the platform to save costs.
B) The ability to increase the number of users and transactions the platform can handle without compromising performance.
C) The ability to scale down operations to reduce workload.
D) The ability to change the platform's design based on user feedback.

Questions.Text: Which of the following best describes a phased rollout?
Options: A) Launching the full platform to all users at once.
B) Gradually releasing the platform to different user groups over time.
C) Rolling back the platform if there are too many bugs.
D) Developing the platform in secret before announcing it to the public.
